column1: nwalme (earlier pronounced ngwalme or ŋwalmeHelge Fauskanger has suggested that the forms nwalmë/ngwalmë (retaining the same meaning) could be valid Neo-Elvish; see http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/wordlists.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo (Quenya Wordlists (accessed 29 November 2010).) is a Quenya noun meaning "torment".
Image:Nwalme.gifNwalme is also the name in Quenya of the twentieth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  It is the fourth letter of the fifth grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "nasal" consonants and it is the fifth letter in the fourth series of consonants.  For written Quenya or Sindarin
column3: the fourth series is used for labialized or kw-series
column5: and Nwalme represents NGW or ŊW.  In Westron the fourth series is used for the k-series
column7: and this letter represents NG or Ŋ.  The Westron name for this letter is Ngá.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme ÑGWAL.
* http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist edited by Helge Fauskanger
